quotes.quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
In order to be irreplaceable, one must always be different.
Java is to JavaScript what car is to carpet.
Knowledge is power.
Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
Ruby is rubbish! PHP is phpantastic!
Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
Fix the cause, not the symptom.
Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
The only way to go fast is to go well.
Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
The best error message is the one that never shows up.
Deleted code is debugged code.
Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
When in doubt, leave it out.
Code is read more than it is written.
Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however, they should not be combined.
If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
To iterate is human, to recurse divine.
A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
Programming is like writing a book... except if you miss a single comma on page 126, the whole thing makes no sense.
The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
Programs are meant to be read by humans and only incidentally for computers to execute.
Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
Programming is not about typing, it’s about thinking.
The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
Code quality matters.
There is no programming language, no matter how structured, that will prevent programmers from making bad programs.
The best code is no code at all.
Code should be simple and clear.
It’s not a bug – it’s an undocumented feature.
A program is never less than 90% complete and never more than 95% complete.
Debugging is like being the detective in a crime drama where you are also the murderer.
In theory, theory and practice are the same. In practice, they’re not.
Programming is the closest thing we have to magic.
The only constant in programming is change.
Write code as if you had to support it for the rest of your life.
All code is guilty until proven innocent.
Good code is like a good joke – it needs no explanation.
Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
One man’s crappy software is another man’s full-time job.
Programming is thinking, not typing.
A program that produces incorrect results twice as fast is infinitely slower.
The best programs are written so that computing machines can perform them quickly and so that human beings can understand them clearly.
Truth can only be found in one place: the code.
Beware of bugs in the above code; I have only proved it correct, not tried it.
The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components of a computer system are those that aren’t there.
Programming without an overall architecture or design in mind is like exploring a cave with only a flashlight: you don’t know where you’ve been, where you are, or where you’re going.
You can have data without information, but you cannot have information without data.
Copy and paste is a design error.
Make your code easy to delete, not easy to extend.
A great coder is not one who writes code well but one who understands problems well.
Don’t write better error messages; write code that doesn’t need them.
A computer is like a violin. You can imagine a novice trying first a phonograph and then a violin. The latter is hard to use. But with practice, it becomes beautiful.
Programming is the art of telling another human what one wants the computer to do.
Testing can show the presence of bugs, but not their absence.
The best programmers don’t just write code; they also write understanding.
Simple things should be simple, complex things should be possible.
Elegance is not a dispensable luxury but a quality that decides between success and failure.
Your job is not to write code. Your job is to solve problems.
If you don’t write your own story, someone else will.
A programmer who refuses to keep learning is no programmer at all.
The sooner you start to code, the longer the program will take.
The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
Code should tell a story.
Every line of code you write is a liability.
Commenting your code is like cleaning your room.
Code is not just code; it’s a story of how your mind works.
The code you write defines your legacy.
Every piece of code can be beautiful.
Always be coding.
Never stop learning, because life never stops teaching.
Programming is an adventure into the unknown.
The best code is no code.
Code as if the next person to maintain it is a violent psychopath.
Good software, like good wine, takes time.
Your code reflects who you are.
The only shortcut in programming is not taking shortcuts.
Code is poetry.
Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place.
Learn to love the process, not just the result.
Coding is a journey, not a destination.
Write less code, achieve more.
Stay hungry, stay coding.
The only way to write good code is to love what you do.
